title: The Great Advance
opening: Three years ago, Crimea freed itself from Daein tyranny. Its nobles used that freedom to berate the queen and scrabble for power. Disgusted with their greed and arrogance, Ike and the Greil Mercenaries left the court behind and returned to work. Thanks to their efforts and to Queen Elincia's even-handed rule, Crimea has avoided a bloody civil war.

Before departing the capital once again, Ike receives disquieting news from Queen Elincia. The Black Knight, the man who murdered Ike's father, has once again been seen in Daein. The queen's words hang heavy over Ike as he leads the mercenary group back to their headquarters.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Flaguerre is close now. It's a fortress city near the Begnion border. We'll storm the city at night and hit them fast enough that the troops inside the fortress won't have time to take their positions.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Yes! Finally, a chance to rend my foes! But I would rather have a head-on fight. Why do we wait until nightfall, like a pack of cowards?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What's our role in this?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I want the Greil Mercenaries to act as a guerrilla force. Take out their fire mages and ballistae. They're really bad news for us laguz.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Bah, enough talking! To the battlefield, to taste my enemies' fear! No more waiting!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: No, Skrimir. This isn't the kind of fight where a general takes the field. You should stay behi--

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Are you insane?! Oh, I'll fight! A general of Gallia does not hide behind his men! Leave this "tactics" garbage to the beorc. We need only our claws and teeth! I call an end to this meeting! Time to kill!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Wait! Skrimir! Blast.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you OK?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Yeah. That thickheaded fool... This'll be his first major battle. Hopefully, he won't get his teeth kicked out. How about you, Ike? Are you sure about this?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Sure about what?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Well, you know.. You're beorc. I'm laguz. You sure you want to take our side?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: The Laguz Alliance is in the right, Ranulf. The senate is actively ignoring you, and worse, they're murdering your messengers. Why shouldn't we help you get the senate's attention? I'm sure my people understand. Besides, I would never abandon a friend in need.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Thanks, Ike.

intro.speaker: Septimus
intro.line: Oh, this is lunacy! Look how meager our force is, especially considering our proximity to Gallia!

intro.speaker: Silvano
intro.line: General Septimus, sir, we're only making the rounds this evening. We don't need a bigger force.

intro.speaker: Septimus
intro.line: No, you're wrong! Even now, those bloodthirsty beasts are stalking us. I just know it! Believe me!

intro.speaker: Silvano
intro.line: General, p-please calm yourself. You say this every evening, and yet we've never had any--

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: E-enemy fire! We're under attack! It's those Gallian beasts! The sub-humans are attacking us!

intro.speaker: Silvano
intro.line: What?!

intro.speaker: Septimus
intro.line: See? See?! Now do you see, fool?! I was right! Hah, I told you...um... N-now what do we do?

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Run down all who get in your way! Make your path of blood and bone! Advance! Advance! Advance!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yeesh, glad he's on our side! I see the family resemblance. Keep up, everyone! Let's get to work!

narration: The Laguz Alliance sacks Flaguerre with ease and sets off immediately for Mugill. The fortresses of Felirae and Mugill are both key to the defense of western Begnion and have figured for many years in the military plans of Gallia, Crimea, and Daein.

The fortress of Mugill is well defended by thick walls and countless blades. However, the Laguz Alliance knows that, if they are to win this war, Mugill must fall. Ike and his companions march on, though thoughts of the medallion and the dark god entombed within fill their hearts with dread.

battle.speaker: Skrimir
battle.line: Weaklings! Where is your general? Come out and fight, coward! I am Skrimir, general of Gallia!

battle.speaker: Septimus
battle.line: Oh no! They're drawing near! We're finished! We're doomed!

battle.speaker: Silvano
battle.line: P-please be quiet, General! You'll hurt the troops' morale! Wait, where are you going?!

battle.speaker: Septimus
battle.line: To safety! I must escape to Mugill. The beasts... The beasts wish to... CONSUME ME!

battle.speaker: Silvano
battle.line: General Septimus! Gutless coward! Are you scared of these worthless sub-humans?!

boss.speaker: Silvano
boss.line: Wait, there are beorc among them? Why would beorc fight alongside sub-humans?

boss.speaker: Silvano
boss.line: Sub-humans... You dare to fight Begnion? There's no hope for you now. This will be your end. Mark...my words...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Are we done?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Yeah. The guards are dead, and the rest of the troops fled to the east. We're in good shape.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Bah! Is that it? I still crave blood! Find me more humans to kill!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The civilians have no quarrel with us, and the soldiers who surrendered have handed over their weapons.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Grrrrr. If this is all the fight Begnion can give, this war will be over too soon!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: I wouldn't be so sure. We won this fight, yes, but the empire has a massive army. Don't forget that there was a time when Begnion ruled over us.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Hmph. You forget...that was before my time.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Did you listen to a word I just said?

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Soldiers of Gallia! The battle is over! We have won! No human can stand against the laguz! We are not done yet! We'll continue to fight, kill, and crush our enemies!

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: My... What a stupid speech.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Don't say things like that. I hear that King Caineghis of Gallia was not so different when he was young. So try not to judge so quickly.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I don't know. That's really hard to imagine.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: I'm sure that Skrimir will settle down, given time. Well, I hope so, anyway...

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Victory awaits us in Mugill! We shall attack, conquer, and celebrate our victory!

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Ike, I've been thinking. Is this war...something that we should really be fighting? After all, we know about Lehran's Medallion...

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: "As long as the dark god sleeps within the medallion, the world shall not war." Is that what you mean?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: That's right. Our ancestors made a vow, and it's our responsibility to prevent the horror they strove against.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: "Chaos is born of strife." "If the land is covered in war, the dark god will break free of the medallion and destroy the world." This war could easily spread across Tellius, and the dark god could be awakened. We were very fortunate during the Mad King's War, but it was a close call. Can we count on being lucky again? Already, we're talking about a war between Begnion, the largest nation on Tellius, and three laguz countries. That's half the known world, and it's not over yet. Have they all forgotten about the possibility of the dark god's rebirth?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Hello, all. Sorry to interrupt. Lady Titania, Soren, you're both very perceptive. I'd expect nothing less from the deputy commander and the strategist of the Greil Mercenaries. You don't have to worry, though. The whole situation is under control.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: The medallion is under the protection of the Serenes royal family. Even if the god escaped, the herons can control it with their galdrar.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Reyson, Leanne, and...Prince Rafiel, was it?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Ah. Ages ago, the heron leader Lehran sealed the dark god within the medallion. His descendants have therefore been taught how to subdue it with their seid magic.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: So that's the story. We'll be relying heavily on the power of the Greil Mercenaries. I'm counting on you all.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Understood. We'll do our best to see this conflict finished as quickly as possible. Right, Ike?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Yes. Of course.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Sigh…

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Are you all right? You look distracted.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Hmm? Oh, it’s nothing. Don’t worry about me.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Ranulf, you know you can talk to me.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Sigh. It’s just… I feel bad about this whole thing, you know?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I’m not sure I understand what you mean.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: I’ve pulled you beorc into laguz affairs. It’s not exactly your problem, you know?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Listen. You offered me a job, and I decided to take the contract. It’s as simple as that. I told the others they could leave if they didn’t want to work with laguz, but everybody decided they’d rather stay. Don’t worry about it, Ranulf.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: What about the Black Knight? Are you going to abandon your search?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yeah, at least for now. I figure that if he’s still alive, our paths will cross again. There’s no rush.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Hmm… Yeah, I guess you’re right. No point in dwelling on things I can’t change, right? Thanks, Ike.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hey, no problem. Anything to keep you from moping around like a sullen kid!

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Fair enough. Besides, I’ve had this nagging headache ever since I left Gallia with that hotheaded lion…

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Do you mean General Skrimir?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: That’s the one. Skrimir is King Caineghis’s nephew, and is on track to become the next king of Gallia.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: He’s the successor to Caineghis? He must be an absolute terror in battle.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Absolutely. He’s so powerful, I think he’s gonna get himself in trouble. And… He’s the reason for my headache.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You need a sympathetic ear about that, too?

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Thanks, Ike. But I’ll tell you about it some other time. Let’s eat and catch some shut-eye before we set off for battle tonight.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: All right.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: See you at dinner.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Hey, Ranulf!

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Yeah?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You can come talk to me anytime you want. Don’t think you’re alone in all this.

conversation.speaker: Ranulf
conversation.line: Heh… What are you, an inquisitor?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: A guy’s got to do something between battles. Talk to you later.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: To be honest, I didn’t want you to come along on this mission.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Really? Well, it’s not like you could have stopped me, even if you wanted to. Ranulf is my friend too, you know!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Come on, Mist. I--

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Ike! I’m not going to repeat the same mistake I made with Dad! I don’t want you to die while I… while I’m somewhere else. It was horrible… It ate me up from the inside. I’m never going through something like that ever again.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Mist…

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Everyone in the Greil Mercenaries is part of a family. We all follow the commander, no matter what. We’ll live together, fight together, and die together. Right, Ike?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: …All right. But promise me this. When we’re out on the battlefield, stay where I can see you. It’ll put my mind at ease.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: I promise, Ike.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Ah! Ike, beorc hero! How are you?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Pretty good.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Giffca and Ranulf told me about you. You are a skilled warrior, right?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well… I don’t think I’m a pushover. I’ll say that much.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Don’t be humble! My uncle… Er, my king also told me about you. "Observe Ike and learn his skills. Then you shall become even stronger."

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: King Caineghis said that?

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: He did. I am eager to watch you in battle. You can learn from me, as well.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I intend to.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Lions are the strongest of the beast tribe, and I have been trained to fight by the king himself. I was going to fight in the Mad King’s War, but my uncle forbade it. He said I still had much to learn. But now my time has come, and you will see the true might of the beasts!

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: …So, what do you think?

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: Ahh! These are all the favorite foods of the beast tribe. They will be happy.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Oscar, you’re a chef?

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: That’s right.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Hah! Great! I can’t wait to see the looks on all their faces when they learn that a beorc made all this delicious food!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Aww, stop it. You’re embarrassing me!

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: But it’s true! Where did you learn all this, Oscar? You should start teaching classes.

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: Yes, your food very good! So good, it will be eaten very quickly.

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Really? Hmm. Do you think I should make more?

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Us beasts have a healthy appetite, of course. On top of that, we have General Skrimir and Ike. …Yeah. I’d be surprised if what’s here lasted past those two, much less a whole pack of laguz.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: Tsk, you’re exaggerating! Ike is a beorc. He couldn’t possibly eat as much as someone from the beast tribe. Well, maybe he would. Actually… He most definitely would.

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: Yeah. Especially the ribs and steaks.

conversation.speaker: Lethe
conversation.line: Mordecai. How about we go hunt for more game?

conversation.speaker: Mordecai
conversation.line: Right!

conversation.speaker: Oscar
conversation.line: There probably aren’t enough herbs to flavor everything. I’ll go get more.

conversation.speaker: Titania
conversation.line: My. We might need to harvest an entire mountain.
